### collectBitParts() {#aa16fecc86f9853cc81abd01a5a6f1604}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>static const std::optional&lt; BitPart &gt; &amp; collectBitParts (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42; V, bool MatchBSwaps, bool MatchBitReversals, std::map&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42;, std::optional&lt; BitPart &gt; &gt; &amp; BPS, int Depth, bool &amp; FoundRoot)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
Analyze the specified subexpression and see if it is capable of providing pieces of a bswap or bitreverse.

The subexpression provides a potential piece of a bswap or bitreverse if it can be proved that each non-zero bit in the output of the expression came from a corresponding bit in some other value. This function is recursive, and the end result is a mapping of bitnumber to bitnumber. It is the caller&#39;s responsibility to validate that the bitnumber to bitnumber mapping is correct for a bswap or bitreverse.

For example, if the current subexpression if &quot;(shl i32 %X, 24)&quot; then we know that the expression deposits the low byte of X into the high byte of the result and that all other bits are zero. This expression is accepted and a <a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-local-cpp-/bitpart">BitPart</a> is returned with Provider set to X and Provenance&#91;24-31&#93; set to &#91;0-7&#93;.

For vector types, all analysis is performed at the per-element level. No cross-element analysis is supported (shuffle/insertion/reduction), and all constant masks must be splatted across all elements.

To avoid revisiting values, the <a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-local-cpp-/bitpart">BitPart</a> results are memoized into the provided map. To avoid unnecessary copying of BitParts, BitParts are constructed in-place in the <code>BPS</code> map. Because of this <code>BPS</code> needs to store BitParts objects, not pointers. As we need the concept of a nullptr BitParts (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> has been analyzed and the analysis failed), we an Optional type instead to provide the same functionality.

Because we pass around references into <code>BPS</code>, we must use a container that does not invalidate internal references (std::map instead of <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/densemap">DenseMap</a>).

Definition at line <a href="#l03849">3849</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/utils/local-cpp">Local.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/check">Check</a> if a bitcast between a value of type <code>FromTy</code> to type <code>ToTy</code> would losslessly preserve the bits and semantics of the value.

This predicate is symmetric, i.e swapping <code>FromTy</code> and <code>ToTy</code> should give the same result.

Note that Type::canLosslesslyBitCastTo is not suitable here because it allows semantically unequivalent bitcasts, such as &lt;2 x i64&gt; -&gt; &lt;4 x i32&gt;, and also does not allow lossless pointer &lt;-&gt; integer conversions.

<Link id="l01097" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1097"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01098" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1098"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// We are merging two blocks - BB, and the block containing PN - and</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01099" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1099"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// as a result we need to redirect edges from the predecessors of BB</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01100" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1100"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// to go to the block containing PN, and update PN</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01101" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1101"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// accordingly. Since we allow merging blocks in the case where the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01102" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1102"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// predecessor and successor blocks both share some predecessors,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01108" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1108"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01109" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1109"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If this incoming value is one of the PHI nodes in BB, the new entries</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01111" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1111"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a92ca992e52dddc420f4b069cae06dfbe">isa&lt;PHINode&gt;</a>(OldVal) &amp;&amp; <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ac4fc845f5ed92de63cd4474f128f5fc5">cast&lt;PHINode&gt;</a>(OldVal)-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/basicaliasanalysis-cpp/#a1b8850f1ed44c12bc3501175a71c251c">getParent</a>() == BB) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01113" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1113"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">for</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> i = 0, e = OldValPN-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/phinode/#aef51af4b490af6b3bf2dfbc8737a8f9f">getNumIncomingValues</a>(); i != e; ++i) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01114" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1114"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Note that, since we are merging phi nodes and BB and Succ might</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01115" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1115"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// have common predecessors, we could end up with a phi node with</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01116" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1116"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// identical incoming branches. This will be cleaned up later (and</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01117" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1117"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// will trigger asserts if we try to clean it up now, without also</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01118" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1118"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// simplifying the corresponding conditional branch).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01180" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1180"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01181" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1181"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Check to see if merging these blocks/phis would cause conflicts for any of</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01182" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1182"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the phi nodes in BB or Succ. If not, we can safely merge.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01183" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1183"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01184" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1184"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Check for cases where Succ has multiple predecessors and a PHI node in BB</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01185" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1185"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// has uses which will not disappear when the PHI nodes are merged.  It is</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01186" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1186"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// possible to handle such cases, but difficult: it requires checking whether</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01187" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1187"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// BB dominates Succ, which is non-trivial to calculate in the case where</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01188" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1188"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Succ has multiple predecessors.  Also, it requires checking whether</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01189" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1189"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// constructing the necessary self-referential PHI node doesn&#39;t introduce any</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01190" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1190"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// conflicts; this isn&#39;t too difficult, but the previous code for doing this</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01191" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1191"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// was incorrect.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01192" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1192"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01193" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1193"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Note that if this check finds a live use, BB dominates Succ, so BB is</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01194" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1194"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// something like a loop pre-header (or rarely, a part of an irreducible CFG);</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01195" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1195"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// folding the branch isn&#39;t profitable in that case anyway.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01196" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1196"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (!Succ-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock/#a59fb91d1691350f7d1b8e8a114e3f2a4">getSinglePredecessor</a>()) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01214" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1214"><Highlight kind="normal">                      &lt;&lt; CommonPred-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value/#adb5c319f5905c1d3ca9eb5df546388c5">getName</a>() &lt;&lt; </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;\\n&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01215" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1215"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01216" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1216"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// &#39;BB&#39; and &#39;BB-&gt;Pred&#39; are loop latches, bail out to presrve inner loop</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01217" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1217"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// metadata.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01218" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1218"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01219" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1219"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// FIXME: This is a stop-gap solution to preserve inner-loop metadata given</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01220" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1220"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// current status (that loop metadata is implemented as metadata attached to</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01221" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1221"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the branch instruction in the loop latch block). To quote from review</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01222" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1222"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// comments, &quot;the current representation of loop metadata (using a loop latch</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01223" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1223"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// terminator attachment) is known to be fundamentally broken. Loop latches</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01224" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1224"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// are not uniquely associated with loops (both in that a latch can be part of</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01225" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1225"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// multiple loops and a loop may have multiple latches). Loop headers are. The</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01226" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1226"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// solution to this problem is also known: Add support for basic block</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01227" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1227"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// metadata, and attach loop metadata to the loop header.&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01228" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1228"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01229" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1229"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Why bail out:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01230" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1230"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// In this case, we expect &#39;BB&#39; is the latch for outer-loop and &#39;BB-&gt;Pred&#39; is</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01231" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1231"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the latch for inner-loop (see reason below), so bail out to prerserve</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01232" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1232"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// inner-loop metadata rather than eliminating &#39;BB&#39; and attaching its metadata</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01233" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1233"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// to this inner-loop.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01234" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1234"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// - The reason we believe &#39;BB&#39; and &#39;BB-&gt;Pred&#39; have different inner-most</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01235" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1235"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// loops: assuming &#39;BB&#39; and &#39;BB-&gt;Pred&#39; are from the same inner-most loop L,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01236" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1236"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// then &#39;BB&#39; is the header and latch of &#39;L&#39; and thereby &#39;L&#39; must consist of</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01237" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1237"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// one self-looping basic block, which is contradictory with the assumption.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01238" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1238"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01239" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1239"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// To illustrate how inner-loop metadata is dropped:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01240" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1240"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01241" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1241"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// CFG Before</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01242" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1242"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01243" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1243"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// BB is while.cond.exit, attached with loop metdata md2.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l03699" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3699"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// instructions.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03700" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3700"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03701" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3701"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Doing so would degrade the debugging experience and adversely affect the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03702" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3702"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// accuracy of profiling information.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03703" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3703"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03704" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3704"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Currently, when hoisting the instructions, we take the following actions:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03705" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3705"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// - Remove their debug intrinsic instructions.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03706" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3706"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// - Set their debug locations to the values from the insertion point.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03707" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3707"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03708" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3708"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// As per PR39141 (comment #8), the more fundamental reason why the dbg.values</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03709" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3709"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// need to be deleted, is because there will not be any instructions with a</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03710" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3710"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// DILocation in either branch left after performing the transformation. We</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03711" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3711"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// can only insert a dbg.value after the two branches are joined again.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03712" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3712"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03713" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3713"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// See PR38762, PR39243 for more details.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03714" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3714"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03715" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3715"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// TODO: Extend llvm.dbg.value to take more than one SSA Value (PR39141) to</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03716" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3716"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// encode predicated DIExpressions that yield different results on different</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l03820" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3820"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03821" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3821"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Analyze the specified subexpression and see if it is capable of providing</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03822" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3822"><Highlight kind="comment">/// pieces of a bswap or bitreverse. The subexpression provides a potential</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03823" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3823"><Highlight kind="comment">/// piece of a bswap or bitreverse if it can be proved that each non-zero bit in</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03824" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3824"><Highlight kind="comment">/// the output of the expression came from a corresponding bit in some other</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03825" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3825"><Highlight kind="comment">/// value. This function is recursive, and the end result is a mapping of</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03826" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3826"><Highlight kind="comment">/// bitnumber to bitnumber. It is the caller&#39;s responsibility to validate that</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03827" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3827"><Highlight kind="comment">/// the bitnumber to bitnumber mapping is correct for a bswap or bitreverse.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03828" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3828"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03829" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3829"><Highlight kind="comment">/// For example, if the current subexpression if &quot;(shl i32 %X, 24)&quot; then we know</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03830" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3830"><Highlight kind="comment">/// that the expression deposits the low byte of %X into the high byte of the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03831" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3831"><Highlight kind="comment">/// result and that all other bits are zero. This expression is accepted and a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03832" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3832"><Highlight kind="comment">/// BitPart is returned with Provider set to %X and Provenance&#91;24-31&#93; set to</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03833" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3833"><Highlight kind="comment">/// &#91;0-7&#93;.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03834" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3834"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03835" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3835"><Highlight kind="comment">/// For vector types, all analysis is performed at the per-element level. No</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03836" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3836"><Highlight kind="comment">/// cross-element analysis is supported (shuffle/insertion/reduction), and all</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03837" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3837"><Highlight kind="comment">/// constant masks must be splatted across all elements.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03838" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3838"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03839" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3839"><Highlight kind="comment">/// To avoid revisiting values, the BitPart results are memoized into the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03840" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3840"><Highlight kind="comment">/// provided map. To avoid unnecessary copying of BitParts, BitParts are</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03841" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3841"><Highlight kind="comment">/// constructed in-place in the \\c BPS map. Because of this \\c BPS needs to</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l03843" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3843"><Highlight kind="comment">/// BitParts (Value has been analyzed and the analysis failed), we an Optional</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03844" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3844"><Highlight kind="comment">/// type instead to provide the same functionality.</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l03851" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3851"><Highlight kind="normal">                </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &amp;FoundRoot) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
